intro: Saurauia aequatoriensis f. veranii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian saurauia, is a botanical variant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and dense foliage, often growing in high-altitude forests. Its leaves are typically dark green and leathery, adapted to the cool, humid conditions of its habitat. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological significance in cloud forest ecosystems.
